patient_info: Nocturia,Proteinuria,Hematuria,Hypertension,Acne,Hyperkalemia,Hypoalbuminemia,Hypercholesterolemia,Hyperuricosuria,Elevated circulating creatinine concentration,Nodular goiter,Abnormal urinary color
golden_diagnosis: Alport syndrome, X-linked,Alport syndrome 2, autosomal recessive,Alport syndrome 3, autosomal dominant,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Erythropoietin-stimulating hormone (ESH) excess leading to ESH-producing tumor (e.g. Cushing's syndrome)
2. Cushing's syndrome due to adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) excess
3. Hypertension (primary or secondary)
4. Hyperkalemia (from excessive ESH production or use of potassium-sparing agents)
5. Hypoalbuminemia (from reduced albumin synthesis or decreased levels of albumin-binding proteins)
6. Hypercholesterolemia (from reduced clearance of LDL(low density lipoprotein) or increased production of cholesterol)
7. Hyperuricosuria (from hypercholesterolemia or use of diuretics)
8. Erythropoietin production by kidney tumor or other kidney disease
9. Erythropoietin production by extrarenal mass such as liver or spleen tumor
10. Diabetes mellitus causing hyperglycemia and proteinuria.
It is important to note that these are just the top 10 possible diagnoses and the actual diagnosis will depend on additional tests, imaging and evaluation.
